accepts-transfers.description: Allows servers to accept incoming transfers via a transfer packet.

allow-flight.description: Allows users to use flight on the server while in Survival mode.

allow-nether.description: Allows players to travel to the Nether.

broadcast-console-to-ops.description: Send console command outputs to all online operators.

broadcast-rcon-to-ops.description: Send rcon console command outputs to all online operators.

difficulty.description: Defines the difficulty of the server.

enable-jmx-monitoring.description: Exposes JMX monitoring of server tick times.

enable-rcon.description: Enables remote access to the server console (RCON).

enable-status.description: Makes the server appear as online in the server list.

enforce-secure-profile.description: Players without a Mojang-signed public key cannot connect.

enforce-whitelist.description: Enforces the whitelist on the server.

entity-broadcast-range-percentage.description: Percentage of default entity broadcast range.

force-gamemode.description: Force players to join in the default game mode.

function-permission-level.description: Sets the default permission level for functions.

generate-structures.description: Determines whether structures (such as villages) can be generated.

generator-settings.description: Settings used to customize world generation (flat world only).

hardcore.description: If true, server difficulty is set to hard and players are set to spectator mode if they die.

hide-online-players.description: If true, a player list is not sent on status requests.

initial-disabled-packs.description: Comma-separated list of datapacks to not be auto-enabled on world creation.

initial-enabled-packs.description: Comma-separated list of datapacks to be enabled during world creation.

level-name.description: The world name and its folder name.

level-seed.description: Sets a world seed; a blank seed generates a random one.

level-type.description: Determines the world preset that is generated.

log-ips.description: If false, client IP addresses are not shown in log messages.

max-chained-neighbor-updates.description: Limit of consecutive neighbor updates before skipping additional ones.

max-players.description: Maximum number of players that can play on the server at the same time.

max-tick-time.description: Maximum number of milliseconds a single tick may take before watchdog stops the server.

max-world-size.description: Maximum world border radius in blocks.

motd.description: Message displayed in the server list of the client, below the name.

network-compression-threshold.description: Packet size threshold at which server packets are compressed.

online-mode.description: Server checks connecting players against Minecraft account database.

player-idle-timeout.description: If non-zero, players are kicked if idle for more than that many minutes.

prevent-proxy-connections.description: If the ISP/AS sent from the server is different from Mojangâ€™s authentication server, the player is kicked.

query.port.description: Port for the query server (see enable-query).

rate-limit.description: Maximum amount of packets a user can send before getting kicked. 0 disables this feature.

region-file-compression.description: Algorithm for compression of chunks in region files.

resource-pack.description: Optional URI to a resource pack.

resource-pack-id.description: Optional UUID for the resource pack.

resource-pack-prompt.description: Custom message shown on resource pack prompt.

resource-pack-sha1.description: Optional SHA-1 digest of the resource pack.

require-resource-pack.description: If true, players are prompted then disconnected if they decline the required pack.

server-ip.description: IP the server binds to; leave blank to bind to all.

simulation-distance.description: Max distance in chunks for entity updates.

snooper-enabled.description: Whether the server sends snoop data regularly to snoop.minecraft.net.

spawn-protection.description: Side length of the square spawn protection area is 2x+1.

view-distance.description: Amount of world data the server sends the client (chunks in each direction).

white-list.description: Enables a whitelist on the server.
